title: Newton's Third Law
description: Professor Walter Lewin uses a gas powered bicycle to prove Newton's Third Law

title: First Law of Thermodynamics
description: The first law of thermodynamics is shown in two different ways

title: Charles's Law
description: Charles's Law, part of the ideal gas equation, is demonstated using a balloon and nitrogen

title: Time Dilation
description: Clocks on a plane and on the ground are compared using Einstein's theory

title: Doppler Effect
description: The Doppler effect is demonstarted by spinning a tuning fork

title: Millikan Oil-Drop
description: The charge of an electron can be found by suspending droplets of oil in an electric field

title: Photoelectric Effect
description: See the difference between visible and ultraviolet light on zinc

title: Blackbody Radiation
description: The intensty of blackbody radiation at different temperatures is simulated

title: Rutherford's Gold Foil
description: A modern reconstruction of the famous Rutherford gold foil experiment

title: Franck-Hertz Experiment
description: Professor Byron L Youtz recreates this experiment by shooting electrons through mercury

title: Single Slit Diffraction
description: Professor Boyd F. Edwards demonstartes the double slit experiment with light

title: Young's Double Slit
description: Professor Boyd F. Edwards demonstartes light diffraction through a single slit

title: Simple Harmonic Motion
description: An explanation of a simple mass spring system by Professor Boyd F. Edwards

title: Zeeman Effect
description: The Georg-August University conducts an experiment to show the Zeeman effect

title: Hydrogen Spectra
description: The spectra for hydrogen is shown using a gas spectra tube and a grating

title: Joule's Paddle Wheel
description: A replica of Joule's paddle wheel, which he used to show the equivalence of work and heat

title: Liquid Helium
description: Ben Miller presents two peculiar properties of supercooled liquid helium

title: Creating a Hologram
description: Nick Brandreth goes over the process of creating a hologram by using a laser

title: Thermal Expansion
description: The thermal expansion of steel, copper, and alluminium is measured

title: Thermal Conductivity
description: The thermal conductivity of steel, copper, and brass is compared with a bunsen burner

title: Meissner Effect
description: The Meissner effect is shown using liquid nitrogen, resulting in a floating magnet

title: Seebeck Effect
description: The Seebeck effect is shown using a bismuth bar, a copper bracket, and a damped magnet

title: Alpha, Beta, and Gamma Radiation
description: The penetrating power of alpha, beta, and gamma radiation is tested

title: Carbon Dating
description: Christine Prior explains the process of radiocarbon dating using a textile sample
